list.name: Changes
list.comment: Upgraded the dashboard so that a user will be notified of any reviews that are due and provides the details and links user to decks with cards due for review

task.summary: Default task
Added a secure 'SECRET_KEY'
Created a generic placeholder template 'base.html' to be inherited after further styling
Modified app structure to make the design modular, more structured, and easier to maintain
Small changes to "base.html", adjusting styling and creating a 'heading' block to be inherited

Added a registration form and initial 'user' db model. Valid completion of the registration form successfully registers a user with account information and hashed passwords stored securely in the databse.
Small adjustment to "base.html" to ensure headings are all inherited from this base template

Adjusted "register.html" so that it displays errors if registration form data is invalid such as invalid email, passwords don't match, username or email taken. TODO: Create password constraint to force users to create a more secure password.

Adjusted "register.html" so that it displays errors if registration form data is invalid such as invalid email, passwords don't match, username or email taken. TODO: Create password constraint to force users to create a more secure password.

Using flask_login, added login functionality including an adaptation to "base.html" such that the taskbar is appropriate for the given login status. Created a placeholder dashboard for logged in users
Added a "LoginEvent" model to track each instance of a user logging in to the application. This will be used for features such as daily login streaks.
Small experiments with "get_login_count" and "get_latest_login" user functions
Imported flask_migrate to preserve database records between changes to database models
Implemented a simple Deck creation feature, inside a new blueprint "Decks" where more complex features such as card creation and edit/manage deck will also be kept

Moved "Decks.html" to relevant subfolder and updated the template to display the current_user's Decks with placeholders for number of cards, cards due for review, and date of next and most recent reviews
Added a card creation feature which allows user to create a new card with a front and back and select a deck to add this to
Added 2 files to git which were not being tracked
Small fix to ensure the select deck dropdown menu only shows decks associated with the current user
Fixed error caused by redundant user_id in add_Card route logic

Implemented feature for users to click on one of their decks and view the cards in that deck. Users can click a button to reveal the answer on the back of the card and can click another button to edit either side of the card

Added buttons to delete cards and decks. Both buttons require confirmation from user before deleting. Upon deletion of a deck, all cards are deleted from that first as part of the delete_deck function

Added buttons to delete cards and decks. Both buttons require confirmation from user before deleting. Upon deletion of a deck, all cards are deleted from that first as part of the delete_deck function

Improved the layout of the card review screen. Cards are now displayed in a rectangle to give the impression of authentic flashcards. Cards can be flipped by clicking "show answer" or pressing spacebar for enhanced usability. Flipping of cards implemented using basic Javascript.
Small changes allowing users to press Left Arrow if they recall the card incorrectly, and Right Arrow if correct
Using Javascript fore enforced delays, implemented visible feedback on Correct/ Incorrect button presses

Added ReviewOutcome model to track user performance on the review of each card, and added logic in process_review and review_summary to store and display this information to users after each review session, identified by session_id in ReviewOutcome
Added a Share Deck button and shared boolean field as part of the Deck Model. Also added public_decks.html which will be integrated soon
Implemented a basic public_decks.html page which will soon allow users to clone a deck to their own Decks page
Small adjustments to public_decks. Now any user can view the deck and each card within the deck, but only the creator of the deck can edit or delete it
Further improvements to public decks, providing the creator's username alongside each shared deck. User's deck share button now responds to the shared status of the deck in question.
Users can now clone an entire deck from public_decks into their own collection of decks, allowing them to review and manage the cards in that deck for their own requirements

Implemented a more accurate scheduling system based on a biweekly version of the Leitner system. Small changes to decks.html to be more responsive. Scheduling calendar relies on calculations which start from the date a user first reviews a deck.
Upgraded the dashboard so that a user will be notified of any reviews that are due and provides the details and links user to decks with cards due for review
